intro: Pimpinella magna var. pinnatifida, commonly known as the broad-leaved cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features large, pinnately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and white, typically arranged in compound umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
